A Randomized Phase III Study of Pembrolizumab versus Placebo in Patients with Hepatocellular Carcinoma with Complete Radiological Response Post Surgery or Ablation and Positive for PDL1 Expression
;
;
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC).
2. Complete radiological response achieved post surgery or ablation as per RECIST 1.1 criteria.
3. Positive for PDL1 expression in tumor tissue as determined by an FDA-approved test.
4. Age ≥ 18 years.
5. ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
6. Adequate organ function.
7. Participants with Child-Pugh A liver function.
8. Ability to provide tissue from an archival tissue sample or willing to undergo a biopsy.
9. Non-pregnant and non-nursing. Participants must agree to use effective contraception during the study and for 6 months after the last dose of study drug.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Prior systemic therapy for HCC including chemotherapy, targeted therapy, or immunotherapy.
2. Active autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment in the past 2 years.
3. History of a second malignancy unless potentially curative treatment has been completed with no evidence of malignancy for 2 years.
4. Presence of untreated or symptomatic CNS metastases.
5. History of (non-infectious) pneumonitis that required steroids or current pneumonitis.
6. Known history of HIV, Hepatitis B (except for those with hepatitis B surface antigen [HBsAg] cleared), or Hepatitis C virus infection.
7. Any condition that requires concurrent use of systemic corticosteroids (greater than 10mg daily prednisone equivalents) or other immunosuppressive medications within 14 days of trial treatment start.
8. Known hypersensitivity to pembrolizumab or any of its excipients.
9. Any psychological, familial, sociological, or geographical condition potentially hampering compliance with the study protocol and follow-up schedule.

A Phase II, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of AZD9291 in Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) Patients with EGFR T790M Mutation After Failure of First-Line EGFR-TKI Therapy

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of stage IIIB or IV NSCLC.
2. Documented evidence of tumor harboring an EGFR T790M mutation as identified by a validated test.
3. Disease progression during or after treatment with a first-line EGFR-TKI (e.g., erlotinib, gefitinib, or afatinib).
4. Age ≥ 18 years.
5. ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
6. At least one measurable lesion as defined by RECIST 1.1.
7. Adequate organ and marrow function.
8. Ability to swallow and retain oral medication.
9. Women of childbearing potential and men must agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 90 days following completion of therapy.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Prior treatment with any drug targeting EGFR T790M mutation.
2. Presence of any other known resistance mutations in the EGFR gene (e.g., C797S).
3. Known symptomatic brain metastases requiring steroids, or brain metastases that have not been stable for at least 4 weeks after treatment and have not been imaged within 2 weeks prior to study entry.
4. History of interstitial lung disease or pneumonitis.
5. Active infection requiring systemic therapy.
6. Uncontrolled hypertension, unstable angina, symptomatic congestive heart failure, or serious cardiac arrhythmia requiring medication.
7. History of another malignancy within 2 years prior to study entry, except for adequately treated basal cell or squamous cell skin cancer, or carcinoma in situ.
8. Pregnant or breastfeeding women.
9. Known psychiatric or substance abuse disorders that would interfere with cooperation with the requirements of the trial.
10. Treatment with any other investigational agents or participation in another clinical trial with therapeutic intent within 4 weeks prior to study entry.

A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Phase III Study of the Efficacy and Safety of Pembrolizumab (MK-3475) in Combination with Axitinib versus Axitinib Alone in Patients with Advanced Renal Cell Carcinoma (RCC) with PD-L1 Positive Tumors

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically confirmed diagnosis of advanced RCC.
2. PD-L1 positive tumor expression as determined by an FDA-approved test.
3. Clear cell RCC component.
4. No prior systemic therapy for advanced RCC.
5. ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
6. Measurable disease according to RECIST 1.1.
7. Adequate organ function.
8. Male and female subjects of childbearing potential must agree to use an adequate method of contraception for the duration of the study and for 120 days after the last dose of study medication.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Presence of sarcomatoid features in the tumor.
2. Known additional malignancy that is progressing or requires active treatment, except for basal cell carcinoma of the skin, squamous cell carcinoma of the skin, or in situ cervical cancer that has undergone potentially curative therapy.
3. Active autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment in the past 2 years.
4. History of (non-infectious) pneumonitis that required steroids or current pneumonitis.
5. Active brain metastases or leptomeningeal metastases.
6. An active infection requiring systemic therapy.
7. A history of a severe hypersensitivity reaction to pembrolizumab and/or axitinib or any of their excipients.
8. Currently participating and receiving study therapy or has participated in a study of an investigational agent and received study therapy or used an investigational device within 4 weeks of the first dose of treatment.
9. Known psychiatric or substance abuse disorders that would interfere with cooperation with the requirements of the trial.
10. Pregnant or breastfeeding, or expecting to conceive or father children within the projected duration of the trial, starting with the pre-screening or screening visit through 120 days after the last dose of trial treatment.

A Phase II, Open-Label, Randomized Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of AZD9291 versus Standard of Care EGFR-TKI as First-Line Treatment in Patients with EGFRm Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer with a Focus on CNS Efficacy

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of locally advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
2. Documented evidence of an activating mutation in the EGFR gene (exon 19 deletions or exon 21 L858R substitution mutations).
3. No prior treatment for advanced or metastatic disease; patients may have received prior adjuvant therapy if completed more than 6 months before the diagnosis of advanced disease.
4. Measurable disease according to RECIST v1.1 criteria.
5. ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
6. Age ≥ 18 years.
7. Adequate organ and marrow function.
8. Willingness to provide tissue from a newly obtained core or excisional biopsy of a tumor lesion.
9. Patients with stable, treated brain metastases are eligible provided they are asymptomatic and do not require steroids for at least 4 weeks before start of study treatment.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Evidence of T790M EGFR mutation.
2. Presence of any other significant genetic alterations in the EGFR gene that are known to confer resistance to EGFR-TKI therapy.
3. Prior treatment with any EGFR-TKI or other systemic treatment for advanced NSCLC.
4. Spinal cord compression unless considered to be stable for > 4 weeks after definitive therapy.
5. History of interstitial lung disease or pneumonitis.
6. Active infections or serious underlying medical conditions that would impair the ability of the patient to receive study treatment.
7. Pregnant or breastfeeding women.
8. Known hypersensitivity to AZD9291 or any of its excipients.
9. Concurrent enrollment in another clinical study involving an investigational product.

A Phase III, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study of Pembrolizumab in Combination with Chemotherapy in Frontline Metastatic Squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Patients with High PD-L1 Expression and No EGFR or ALK Genomic Tumor Aberrations

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of squamous NSCLC that is metastatic or unresectable.
2. PD-L1 expression ≥50% as determined by an FDA-approved test, with no EGFR or ALK genomic tumor aberrations.
3. No prior systemic treatment for metastatic NSCLC.
4. At least one measurable lesion as defined by RECIST v1.1.
5. ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
6. Age ≥ 18 years.
7. Adequate organ function.
8. Willingness to provide tissue from a newly obtained biopsy of a tumor lesion.
9. Patients with treated brain metastases are eligible if they are stable (without evidence of progression by imaging for at least four weeks after the final dose of radiation and no evidence of new or enlarging brain metastases) and off steroids.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Presence of EGFR mutations or ALK translocations.
2. Prior chemotherapy or targeted small molecule therapy for metastatic NSCLC.
3. Active autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment in the past 2 years.
4. A condition requiring systemic treatment with either corticosteroids (> 10 mg daily prednisone equivalents) or other immunosuppressive medications within 14 days of study drug administration.
5. A history of (non-infectious) pneumonitis that required steroids or current pneumonitis.
6. Active infection requiring systemic therapy.
7. Pregnant or breastfeeding, or expecting to conceive or father children within the projected duration of the study.
8. Known psychiatric or substance abuse disorders that would interfere with cooperation with the requirements of the trial.
9. Prior therapy with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, or anti-PD-L2 agent or with an agent directed to another stimulatory or co-inhibitory T-cell receptor (e.g., CTLA-4, OX-40, CD137).
10. Known hypersensitivity to pembrolizumab or any of its excipients.

A Phase II, Open-Label, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy of ZX008 in Combination with Letrozole in Patients with ER-positive, HER2-negative Advanced Breast Cancer with ESR1 Mutation

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of estrogen receptor (ER)-positive, HER2-negative advanced or metastatic breast cancer.
2. Documented ESR1 mutation detected in circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA) or in a tumor biopsy.
3. Progression on or after at least one line of endocrine therapy for advanced disease.
4. Age ≥ 18 years.
5. ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
6. Measurable disease according to RECIST v1.1 criteria.
7. Adequate organ function as evidenced by laboratory values.
8. Ability to understand and willingness to sign a written informed consent document.
9. Women of childbearing potential must agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 90 days following completion of therapy.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Prior treatment with more than three lines of chemotherapy for advanced/metastatic breast cancer.
2. Known hypersensitivity to ZX008, letrozole, or any of their excipients.
3. Presence of other active cancers, or history of treatment for invasive cancer within the last 5 years. Patients with stage I cancer who have received definitive local treatment and are considered unlikely to recur are eligible.
4. CNS metastases that are symptomatic or require treatment; patients with previously treated CNS metastases that are asymptomatic and stable for at least 4 weeks are eligible.
5. Concurrent use of other investigational drugs or participation in another clinical trial with therapeutic intent.
6. Uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements.
7. Pregnant or breastfeeding women.
8. Known HIV-positive individuals on combination antiretroviral therapy.

A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Phase III Trial of Bemcentinib in Combination with Docetaxel in Patients with MET-Amplified Non-Squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of non-squamous non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
2. Documented MET amplification in tumor tissue or plasma.
3. Progression after platinum-based chemotherapy.
4. Age ≥ 18 years.
5. ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
6. At least one measurable lesion as defined by RECIST v1.1.
7. Adequate organ and marrow function.
8. Ability to swallow and retain oral medication.
9. Signed informed consent form.
10. For women of childbearing potential, agreement to use two forms of effective contraception from the time of signing the informed consent form through 120 days after the last dose of study drug.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Prior treatment with MET inhibitors.
2. Presence of known EGFR mutations or ALK rearrangements.
3. Active brain metastases or leptomeningeal metastases. Patients with previously treated brain metastases that are asymptomatic and stable for at least 4 weeks are eligible.
4. History of another malignancy within 3 years prior to enrollment, except for adequately treated basal cell or squamous cell skin cancer, or in situ cervical cancer.
5. Uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements.
6. Pregnant or breastfeeding women.
7. Known hypersensitivity to bemcentinib, docetaxel, or any of their excipients.
8. Participation in another clinical study with an investigational product during the last 4 weeks.
9. Any psychological, familial, sociological, or geographical condition potentially hampering compliance with the study protocol and follow-up schedule.

A Phase II, Open-Label Study Assessing the Efficacy of Novel Agent ZYB-258 in Combination with Pembrolizumab in Patients with Advanced Melanoma Harboring BRAF V600 Mutations

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically confirmed diagnosis of unresectable Stage III or IV melanoma.
2. Presence of a BRAF V600 mutation in the tumor tissue as confirmed by a CLIA-certified laboratory.
3. Age ≥ 18 years.
4. ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
5. Measurable disease according to RECIST 1.1 criteria.
6. Prior treatment with, and progression on, at least one line of systemic therapy for advanced disease (including BRAF and/or MEK inhibitors if BRAF V600 mutant).
7. Adequate organ and marrow function as defined by laboratory values.
8. Ability to understand and willingness to sign a written informed consent document.
9. Women of childbearing potential and men must agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 90 days following completion of therapy.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Presence of any other BRAF mutations apart from V600.
2. Active brain metastases or leptomeningeal metastases. Patients with previously treated brain metastases may participate provided they are stable, have no evidence of new or enlarging brain metastases, and are not using steroids for at least 14 days prior to trial treatment.
3. History of another malignancy within the last 3 years, except for malignancies with a negligible risk of metastasis or death, such as adequately treated carcinoma in situ of the cervix, non-melanoma skin carcinoma, or localized prostate cancer with Gleason score ≤ 6 and PSA ≤ 10.
4. Any prior therapy with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, or anti-PD-L2 agent or with an agent directed to another co-inhibitory T-cell receptor (e.g., CTLA-4, OX-40, CD137).
5. Known history of, or any evidence of, interstitial lung disease or pneumonitis.
6. Active autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment in past 2 years.
7. Uncontrolled adrenal insufficiency.
8. Known psychiatric or substance abuse disorders that would interfere with cooperation with the requirements of the trial.
9. Pregnant or breastfeeding women.
10. Known hypersensitivity to ZYB-258 or pembrolizumab or any of their excipients.

A Randomized Phase III Study of TKI-3212 in Patients with Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) with MET Exon 14 Skipping Mutations

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of NSCLC that is Stage IV according to the AJCC 8th edition.
2. Documented MET exon 14 skipping mutation in tumor tissue or plasma by an FDA-approved test.
3. Age ≥ 18 years.
4. ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
5. Previously treated with one or two lines of systemic therapy for advanced/metastatic disease, but not previously treated with a MET inhibitor.
6. At least one measurable lesion as defined by RECIST 1.1.
7. Adequate organ function as defined by specific laboratory tests.
8. Ability to swallow and retain oral medication.
9. Willingness to use adequate contraception for the duration of study participation and for 90 days after the last dose of study medication.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Known hypersensitivity to TKI-3212 or its excipients.
2. Presence of EGFR mutations or ALK rearrangements for which targeted therapy is available.
3. Active brain metastases or leptomeningeal metastases. Patients with previously treated brain metastases may participate if they are stable, have no evidence of new or enlarging brain metastases, and are not using steroids.
4. History of interstitial lung disease or pneumonitis that required steroid treatment, or current pneumonitis.
5. Active, known, or suspected autoimmune disease. Patients with type I diabetes mellitus, hypothyroidism only requiring hormone replacement, skin disorders not requiring systemic treatment, or conditions not expected to recur in the absence of an external trigger are permitted to enroll.
6. Receipt of a live vaccine within 30 days prior to the first dose of trial treatment.
7. Any other malignancy from which the patient has been disease-free for less than 2 years, with the exception of adequately treated and cured basal or squamous cell skin cancer, superficial bladder cancer, or carcinoma in situ of the cervix or breast.
8. Major surgery within 4 weeks prior to study entry.
9. Known history of HIV infection, hepatitis B, or hepatitis C.
10. Pregnant or breastfeeding women.
11. Any other condition that would, in the Investigator’s judgment, contraindicate the patient’s participation in the clinical study due to safety concerns or compliance with clinical study procedures.

A Phase II, Open-Label, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of AZD9291 in Combination with Bevacizumab in Patients with EGFR-mutant Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) after Progression on a Previous EGFR-TKI
;
;
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of stage IIIB/IV NSCLC.
2. Documented evidence of EGFR mutation (exon 19 deletions or exon 21 L858R substitution mutations) by a CLIA-certified laboratory (or equivalent).
3. Progression on or after treatment with an FDA-approved EGFR-TKI.
4. Measurable disease according to RECIST v1.1 criteria.
5. Age ≥ 18 years.
6. ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
7. Adequate organ and marrow function.
8. Ability and willingness to comply with the study and follow-up procedures.
9. Ability to understand and willingness to sign a written informed consent document.
10. Women of childbearing potential and men must agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 90 days following completion of therapy.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Presence of T790M mutation.
2. Prior treatment with AZD9291 or any other EGFR T790M targeting agent.
3. Prior treatment with bevacizumab or other VEGF targeting therapies.
4. Brain metastases that are symptomatic or require treatment. Patients with previously treated brain metastases that are asymptomatic without requiring steroids for at least 4 weeks before starting study drug are eligible.
5. History of another malignancy within 3 years prior to enrollment, except for adequately treated basal cell or squamous cell skin cancer, or carcinoma in situ of the cervix.
6. Uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements.
7. Pregnant or breastfeeding women.
8. Known hypersensitivity to AZD9291, bevacizumab, or any of their excipients.
9. Patients who have had chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study or those who have not recovered from adverse events due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier.

A Randomized Phase III Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Pembrolizumab in Combination with Axitinib versus Sunitinib Monotherapy in Treatment-Naïve Patients with Advanced Renal Cell Carcinoma with Sarcomatoid Features
;
;
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically confirmed diagnosis of renal cell carcinoma (RCC) with sarcomatoid features.
2. Advanced (not amenable to curative surgery or radiation therapy) or metastatic RCC.
3. No prior systemic therapy for advanced RCC.
4. Presence of at least one measurable lesion as defined by RECIST 1.1.
5. Age ≥ 18 years.
6. ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
7. Adequate organ function.
8. Must have tissue available for PD-L1 biomarker analysis.
9. Must be able to swallow and retain orally administered medication and must not have any clinically significant gastrointestinal abnormalities that may alter absorption such as malabsorption syndrome or major resection of the stomach or bowels.
10. Written informed consent and any locally required authorization (e.g., HIPAA in the USA, GDPR in the EU) obtained from the patient/legal representative.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Known additional malignancy that is progressing or requires active treatment except for basal cell carcinoma of the skin or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin that has undergone potentially curative therapy or in situ cervical cancer.
2. Active central nervous system (CNS) metastases and/or carcinomatous meningitis.
3. Participants with active, known or suspected autoimmune disease.
4. History of (non-infectious) pneumonitis that required steroids or current pneumonitis.
5. Active infection requiring systemic therapy.
6. Known psychiatric or substance abuse disorders that would interfere with cooperation with the requirements of the trial.
7. Pregnant or breastfeeding, or expecting to conceive or father children within the projected duration of the trial, starting with the pre-screening or screening visit through 120 days after the last dose of trial treatment.
8. Known history of Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) (HIV 1/2 antibodies).
9. Known history of Hepatitis B (e.g., Hepatitis B surface antigen reactive) or known active Hepatitis C virus (e.g., HCV RNA [qualitative] is detected).
10. Patients who have had chemotherapy, targeted small molecule therapy, or radiation therapy within 2 weeks prior to trial treatment start or who have not recovered from adverse events due to a previously administered agent.

A Phase II, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of AZD9291 in Combination with Bevacizumab in Patients with EGFR-mutant Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) After Progression on a Previous EGFR-TKI
;
;
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of stage IV NSCLC with an activating mutation in EGFR (exon 19 deletions or L858R substitution mutations).
2. Documented disease progression during or after treatment with an FDA-approved EGFR-TKI.
3. Measurable disease according to RECIST 1.1.
4. Age ≥ 18 years.
5. ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
6. Adequate organ and marrow function.
7. Must have at least one lesion not previously irradiated that can be accurately measured at baseline as ≥10 mm in the longest diameter (except lymph nodes which must have a short axis ≥15 mm) with CT or MRI and which is suitable for accurate repeated measurements.
8. Women of childbearing potential and men must agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 6 months after the completion of therapy.
9. Ability to understand and willingness to sign a written informed consent document.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Participants with mutations in EGFR T790M, exon 20 insertions, or other resistance mutations not amenable to AZD9291 treatment.
2. Prior treatment with any other EGFR-TKI or bevacizumab.
3. Participants with symptomatic central nervous system (CNS) metastases who are neurologically unstable or require increasing doses of steroids to control their CNS disease.
4. History of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to AZD9291 or bevacizumab.
5. Uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements.
6. Pregnant or breastfeeding women.
7. Known HIV-positive individuals on combination antiretroviral therapy.
8. Any other malignancies within 3 years except for cancers with a negligible risk of metastasis or death, such as adequately treated carcinoma in situ of the cervix, basal or squamous cell skin cancer, localized prostate cancer, or ductal carcinoma in situ treated surgically with curative intent.
9. Presence of a gastrointestinal tract disease causing the inability to take oral medication or a requirement for IV alimentation, prior surgical procedures affecting absorption, or active peptic ulcer disease.

input:
A Randomized, Double-Blind Phase III Trial to Assess the Efficacy of JNJ-63723283, an Anti-PD-1 Monoclonal Antibody, in Combination with Standard Chemotherapy in Patients with Microsatellite Instability-High (MSI-H) or Mismatch Repair Deficient (dMMR) Colorectal Cancer
;
;
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically confirmed diagnosis of metastatic colorectal cancer (CRC) that is MSI-H or dMMR as determined by a local laboratory test.
2. No prior systemic chemotherapy for metastatic CRC. Adjuvant chemotherapy is allowed if completed more than 6 months prior to enrollment.
3. Age ≥ 18 years.
4. ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
5. Measurable disease according to RECIST 1.1.
6. Adequate organ and marrow function.
7. Ability to swallow and retain oral medication.
8. Women of childbearing potential and men must agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 6 months after the last dose of study drug.
9. Signed informed consent and willingness and ability to comply with scheduled visits, treatment plans, laboratory tests, and other study procedures.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Known BRAF V600E mutation (patients with BRAF non-V600E mutations are eligible).
2. Treatment with any other investigational agent or participation in another clinical trial with therapeutic intent within 4 weeks prior to enrollment.
3. Known CNS metastases and/or carcinomatous meningitis.
4. History of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to JNJ-63723283 or other agents used in the study.
5. Uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements.
6. Pregnant or breastfeeding women.
7. Known history of Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) (HIV 1/2 antibodies).
8. Known active Hepatitis B (e.g., HBsAg reactive) or Hepatitis C (e.g., HCV RNA [qualitative] is detected).
9. Live vaccine within 30 days prior to the first dose of trial treatment.
10. Any other condition that would, in the Investigator’s judgment, contraindicate the patient’s participation in the clinical study due to safety concerns or compliance with clinical study procedures, e.g., infection/inflammation, intestinal obstruction, unable to swallow medication, social/psychological issues, etc.

A Phase II, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of AZD9291 (Osimertinib) in EGFR T790M Mutation-Positive Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) After Failure of First-Line EGFR TKI Therapy

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC.
2. Documented evidence of T790M mutation in the EGFR gene as detected by a validated and sensitive assay.
3. Disease progression during or after treatment with a first-line EGFR TKI (e.g., erlotinib, gefitinib, or afatinib).
4. Age ≥ 18 years.
5. ECOG performance status of 0-2.
6. At least one measurable lesion as defined by RECIST v1.1.
7. Adequate bone marrow, liver, and renal function.
8. Ability and willingness to provide informed consent.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Presence of exon 20 insertion mutations in the EGFR gene.
2. Prior treatment with third-generation EGFR TKIs (e.g., osimertinib).
3. Treatment with more than one line of chemotherapy or any other targeted therapy for advanced NSCLC.
4. Known symptomatic brain metastases requiring steroids, or brain metastases that are not stable for > 4 weeks prior to start of study treatment.
5. History of interstitial lung disease or pneumonitis.
6. Uncontrolled concomitant illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements.
7. Pregnant or breastfeeding women.
8. Known hypersensitivity to AZD9291 or any of its excipients.

A Randomized, Open-Label Phase III Study of Pembrolizumab (MK-3475) Plus Enzalutamide Versus Placebo Plus Enzalutamide in Patients with Metastatic Castration-Resistant Prostate Cancer (mCRPC) with Homologous Recombination Repair (HRR) Gene Mutations

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of mCRPC.
2. Presence of a deleterious or suspected deleterious HRR gene mutation (e.g., BRCA1, BRCA2, ATM, CHEK2) identified through a validated genomic assay.
3. Ongoing androgen deprivation therapy with a GnRH analog or bilateral orchiectomy (i.e., must be surgically or medically castrated).
4. Progressive disease as evidenced by one or more of the following: a rise in serum PSA, progression of pre-existing disease, or appearance of new metastases.
5. ECOG performance status of 0-1.
6. Adequate organ function.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Prior systemic therapy with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, or anti-PD-L2 agent or with an agent directed to another co-inhibitory T-cell receptor (e.g., CTLA-4, OX-40, CD137).
2. Treatment with more than two lines of chemotherapy for mCRPC.
3. Known mismatch repair deficiency (dMMR) or microsatellite instability-high (MSI-H) cancer.
4. Active autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment in the past 2 years.
5. Prior treatment with enzalutamide or any other second-generation anti-androgen therapy.
6. Known brain metastases that are untreated, symptomatic, or require therapy to control symptoms.
7. Uncontrolled or significant cardiovascular disease, including recent myocardial infarction, congestive heart failure, unstable angina, or serious cardiac arrhythmia requiring medication.
8. Active infection requiring systemic therapy.
9. A condition requiring systemic treatment with either corticosteroids (> 10 mg daily prednisone equivalents) or other immunosuppressive medications within 14 days of study drug administration.

A Phase II, Open-Label Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of AZD6738 in Combination with Olaparib in Patients with Advanced Solid Tumors Harboring Homologous Recombination Repair (HRR) Gene Mutations

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically or cytologically confirmed advanced solid tumors with documented HRR gene mutations (including but not limited to BRCA1, BRCA2, ATM, CHEK2, RAD51).
2. Age ≥ 18 years.
3. ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
4. Measurable disease according to RECIST 1.1 criteria.
5. Prior chemotherapy, targeted therapy, or immunotherapy is allowed, provided there has been recovery to baseline or ≤ Grade 1 from adverse effects.
6. Adequate bone marrow, liver, and renal function as evidenced by laboratory values.
7. Patients must be willing to undergo a fresh tumor biopsy unless sufficient archival tissue is available for confirmation of HRR gene mutation status.
8. Women of childbearing potential and men must agree to use adequate contraception (hormonal or barrier method of birth control; abstinence) prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 6 months after the last dose.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Known mutations in genes that confer resistance to PARP inhibitors (e.g., BRCA1/2 reversion mutations).
2. Prior treatment with a PARP inhibitor or ATR inhibitor.
3. Active brain metastases or leptomeningeal disease. Patients with previously treated brain metastases that are stable for ≥ 4 weeks following treatment and without steroid requirement for at least 7 days before starting study treatment are eligible.
4. Significant cardiovascular disease, such as heart failure meeting New York Heart Association Class III or IV classification, uncontrolled hypertension, or history of myocardial infarction within the last 6 months.
5. Concurrent use of other anti-cancer therapies or participation in another clinical trial with therapeutic intent.
6. Pregnant or breastfeeding women.
7. Known hypersensitivity to AZD6738, olaparib, or any excipients in the formulations.

input:
A Randomized Phase III Trial of Personalized Neoantigen Vaccine NEO-PV-01 with Nivolumab and Ipilimumab in Patients with Melanoma with High-Risk Genomic Features

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically confirmed melanoma with high-risk genomic features, including but not limited to BRAFV600 mutation, NRAS mutation, or loss of function mutations in PTEN or CDKN2A.
2. Stage III (unresectable) or IV melanoma patients.
3. Age ≥ 18 years.
4. ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
5. Patients must have measurable disease based on RECIST 1.1 criteria.
6. Adequate organ function as defined by study-specific laboratory tests.
7. Willingness to provide tissue from a newly obtained core or excisional biopsy of a tumor lesion. Newly obtained is defined as a specimen obtained up to 6 weeks (42 days) prior to initiation of treatment.
8. Patients must be willing to undergo blood sampling for immune monitoring and neoantigen vaccine production.
9. For women of childbearing potential: agreement to remain abstinent (refrain from heterosexual intercourse) or use contraceptive methods with a failure rate of < 1% per year during the treatment period and for at least 5 months after the last dose of the study treatment.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Presence of any other active malignancy other than melanoma. Patients with history of malignancy that have been completely treated, with no evidence of disease for ≥ 5 years are allowed.
2. Prior therapy with any checkpoint inhibitor (e.g., anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-CTLA-4 antibodies) or cancer vaccine.
3. Known hypersensitivity to nivolumab, ipilimumab, or any component of the NEO-PV-01 vaccine.
4. Active autoimmune disease or history of autoimmune disease that might recur, which may affect vital organ function or require immune suppressive treatment including systemic corticosteroids.
5. Any condition that, in the opinion of the investigator, contraindicates the patient's participation due to safety concerns or compliance with clinical study procedures, e.g., infection, gastrointestinal tract disease causing an inability to take oral medication or a requirement for IV alimentation, prior surgical procedures affecting absorption, and uncontrolled inflammatory GI disease.
6. Pregnant or breastfeeding women.
7. Known psychiatric or substance abuse disorders that would interfere with cooperation with the requirements of the trial.
